title: What is literature review in the scientific method? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, let's define what we mean by literature and literature review: ●literature is the body of knowledge available to you, or what is already known and written down that is relevant to your research project. ●literature review is a process that involves the identification of published work on the topic of interest, the evaluation of this work in relation to the problem and the documentation of this work. So, if you are doing a scientific research, the first thing you should do after choosing your research topic and formulating your hypothesis is to do a literature review in which you will use all possible sources of information about your research topic. These resources are references, text books, articles, and the most important: the work of other researchers before you, I mean reviews and papers published in your field for, at least, 10 years before. Another thing further is to write a “literature review “, something that considered very important in all fields of science in which the work of researchers in one topic, or some related topics is collected, reviewed and written in such away that a science is build of.
